intro: Zosterophyllanthos muriculatus, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Zosterophyllanthos muriculatus thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland desert regions. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
